title: Rani Jhansi Marine National Park
short_description: A secluded marine park in the Ritchie's Archipelago of the Andamans, ideal for eco-tourism.
long_description: Rani Jhansi Marine National Park is located in the Andaman and Nicobar Islands in the Bay of Bengal. It was founded in 1996 and covers 256.14 km2. It commemorates Lakshmibai, the Rani of Jhansi. The park is located in the Ritchie's Archipelago and is around 40 km from Port Blair. It offers a unique collection of coral reefs and mangrove forests. It is less visited compared to Mahatma Gandhi Marine Park, offering a pristine and solitary experience. The park is home to dugongs, crocodiles and various coral species.
wildlife_significance: Important habitat for the Dugong (Sea Cow) and salt-water crocodiles.
guides_and_tips: Requires a chartered boat from Havelock or Neil Island. Very few facilities available.
how_to_reach: By Boat: Access from Havelock Island (Swaraj Dweep).
conservation_notes: Strictly no-development zone to protect the sensitive ecosystem.
sample_itinerary: Day Trip: Charter a boat from Havelock. Cruise around the archipelago. Snorkel (if gear brought). Return.
safety_tips: Crocodiles are present in mangroves; swimming in creeks is dangerous.

entry_fees.notes: Included in boat charter packages usually.

pricing_metadata.disclaimer: Expensive due to private charter needs.
